w23b69068u.name: Assyafaah Mosque
w23b69068u.remarks: This mosque is the fifth one to be built under Phase III of the Mosque Building Fund programme to serve the needs of the Muslim community in the Northern part of Singapore. It also acts as a replacement due to the closure of two old mosques in the Sembawang area - Jumah Sembawang Mosque and Naval Base Mosque. The mosque which can accommodate about 4,000 people at one time was opened to the public on 9th April 2004.

w23b1wt4ps.directions: There is a small office space at a corner for prayer. For direction, enquire Muslim staff.
w23b1wt4ps.name: Sakura Restaurant

w23b42pdn2.name: Ahmad Ibrahim Mosque
w23b42pdn2.remarks: Built in 1958, this old generation zinc-roofed mosque located in the North part of the island serves the religious needs of Muslim living and working in the vicinity. It can accommodate 200 Muslims at any one time. It offers nursery, kindergarten and weekend madrasah classes for children of nearby residents. Altogether, a total of 480 children attend classes at various times, at the masjid. Since the ‘70s, there have been several renovation and repair works carried out.

w23b6cx5zx.name: Petempatan Melayu Sembawang Mosque
w23b6cx5zx.remarks: Surrounded by lush greeneries and a reasonably huge compound, there is an air of serenity at this old generation masjid built in 1970. Located in the North and away from busy streets, it offers weekend madrasah classes as well as religious classes on a weekly basis. It has a capacity of 300 people.

w23b1tr82g.directions: Proceed to level 1 library entrance and enter the exit door on the left. Walk to the end for female area. For male, take the staircase inside to level 2.
w23b1tr82g.name: Civic Centre
w23b1tr82g.remarks: Not an official praying area. Shared male & female area.

w23b1qk2z8.name: An-Nur Mosque
w23b1qk2z8.remarks: Located in the North part of the island, An-Nur is more than just a landmark in Woodlands. The masjid has created a name for its outreach programme and grassroots activities through its Qaryah (outreach) initiatives. It is also one of the masjids, which provide strong support for the kidney donation campaign. Built in 1980 under the Mosque Building fund, An-Nur can accommodate up to 2800 worshippers. There are madrasah and kindergarten classes offered at the masjid to children of the neighbouring estate

w23b1tqdgw.directions: Go past the toilet beside Giordano and turn left into the lift lobby
w23b1tqdgw.name: Causeway Point

w23b4u6c2h.directions: Head to the lift lobby on level 4, nect to Kid@Play waterpark. The lift lobby is right beside the washroom. Enter the staircase landing in front of the cargo lifts. Musolla is on the top floor.
w23b4u6c2h.name: Northpoint
w23b4u6c2h.remarks: Not an official praying area. Shared male & female area. Provision found in the hosereel cabinet.

w23b4v996h.name: Darul Makmur Mosque
w23b4v996h.remarks: Morning is a hectic period at the masjid when doting parents wave their pre-schoolers goodbye. Besides kindergarten classes for these pre-schoolers, the mosque is among the few, which offers a Tahfiz (Al-Quran memorization) course for children. Built in 1989, it serves Muslim families living in Yishun and the North part of the island. The masjid, which falls under Phase Two of the Mosque Building Fund, can accommodate about 3000 people.

w23b1gt51j.name: Yusof Ishak Mosque
w23b1gt51j.remarks: Masjid Yusof Ishak is the 71st mosque in Singapore today, and the fourth mosque built under Phase 4 [1] of the Mosque Building Programme. It is Singapore’s 26th mosque to be funded by the Mosque Building and Mendaki Fund (MBMF). Masjid Yusof Ishak is designed with a unique architecture blending traditional mosque characteristics with Nusantara heritage and elements, while also addressing functional requirements. Distinctive features of a tropical Nusantara house, such as eaves/overhangs, verandah, decorative fixed ventilation panels and beautifully crafted balustrades, are reinterpreted and expressed in a modern way befitting this new generation mosque.

w23b2cjpq5.address: Gertak Merah, Johor Bahru, Johor, Malaysia 80100
w23b2cjpq5.name: MASJID SULTAN ABU BAKAR
w23b2cjpq5.remarks:
Masjid Sultan Abu Bakar tersergam di atas sebuah bukit berhampiran bandar Johor Bahru dan mempunyai pemandangan indah Selat Johor dan Singapura. Masjid ini merupakan salah sebuah masjid lama yang tercantik di Malaysia.

Masjid Sultan Abu Bakar dibina pada 1 Muharam 1310 Hijri bersamaan 26 Julai 1892 Masihi, atas titah Sultan Abu Bakar. Ia terletak berhampiran pejabat Majlis Agama Islam dan Istana Besar Johor Bahru, iaitu di atas Bukit Kecil di Jalan Tun Dr. Ismail, mengadap Selat Tebrau, menjadikan ia antara bangunan yang mempunyai pemandangan yang indah di Johor Bahru.

Upacara perasmian masjid ini telah disempurnakan oleh Sultan Ibrahim (1895-1959) pada 1 Syawal 1317 bersamaan 2 Februari 1900 Masihi. Nama masjid ini diambil sempena nama Sultan Abu Bakar sendiri atau dikenali sebagai Bapa Johor Moden. Masjid ini boleh memuatkan seramai 2,000 orang jemaah pada satu-satu masa.
w23b2cjpq5.directions: Lokasi berdekatan dengan Jabatan Agama Negeri Johor

w23vfcyy06.name: MASJID  BANDAR MERSING
w23vfcyy06.remarks: Masjid Jamek Mersing terletak di Bandar Mersing ini telah didirikan pada 7 Syawal 1375 Hijri bersamaan 18 Mei 1956 Masihi. Upacara peletakan batu asas masjid ini kemudiannya telah disempurnakan oleh Datoâ€™ Syed Alwi, iaitu Mufti Kerajaan Negeri Johor ketika itu pada 24 Zulhijjah 1375 Hijri bersamaan 2 Ogos 1956 Masihi.

w234qrbfr3.address: Kampung Sateh, 83000 Batu Pahat, Johor, Malaysia 83000
w234qrbfr3.name: MASJID DATO' BENTARA LUAR
w234qrbfr3.remarks: Masjid yang telah didirikan pada tahun 1930-an ini terletak di Jalan Masjid, Batu Pahat, iaitu berhadapan Stadium Batu Pahat. Masjid ini pernah dijadikan Masjid Daerah yang utama sebelum pembinaan masjid baru. Bangunan masjid ini masih kukuh dan digunakan sehingga kini.

w238y7f7r5.name: MASJID SULTAN ISMAIL UTM
w238y7f7r5.remarks:
Pembinaan Masjid Sultan Ismail bermula pada tahun 1986 dan telah siap pada tahun 1990 dengan belanja hampir RM 19 juta. Masjid ini telah dirasmikan oleh DYMM Sultan Iskandar Ibni Almarhum Sultan Ismail, Sultan Johor, pada 23 Ogos 1991.

Masjid Sultan Ismail terletak di Dataran Tinggi di tengah-tengah kampus. Kedudukan ini juga selaras dengan konsep pembelajaran Islam yang menjadikan masjid sebagai sumber memperoleh dan menyebarkan ilmu.Masjid Sultan Ismail boleh menampung jemaah lebih daripada 10,000 orang dalam satu-satu masa, termasuk 800 jemaah wanita di dewan solat wanita aras 3. Keluasan lantai keseluruhan Masjid Sultan Ismail adalah lebih kurang 100,000 kaki persegi. Keluasan lantai dewan solat utama adalah lebih kurang 100,000 kaki persegi. Keluasan lantai dewan solat utama adalah 41,000 kaki persegi.

w23b1tpj49.name: Woodlands Regional Library @ Woodlands Civics Centre
w23b1tpj49.directions:
Staircase door right outside Library entrance.

2nd staircase landing included.
